dt:valueDataType.description: The dataType definition that specifies representation of domain values
dt:valueDataType.title: Domain Values Data Type

dt:domainDataTypeLabel.description: free text label for humans to understand the dataType
dt:domainDataTypeLabel.title: Domain Data Type Label

dt:domainDataTypeURI.description: identifier for the datatype of values in the domain
dt:domainDataTypeURI.title: Identifier for data types in the domain

oneOf.title: Primitive Type
oneOf.description: identifier for the dataType definition; primitive types might be defined in various vocabularies, but other dataType Categories should provide URIs for dataType definitions that offer representations using this dataType schema.

oneOf.title: Link to Data Object in this repository

dt:domainType.description: high level categorization of the kind of values in this domain: e.g. narrative text, count,  coordinate measurement, ratio measurement, interval measurement, concept, truth value, DateTime, Date, Time, vector, continuous field, sequence, name, rate, reference (link, foreign key...). (see 19103, maybe ISO80000?)
dt:domainType.title: Domain Type

dt:domainTypeLabel.description: human-readable label that specifies the kind of values in the domain.
dt:domainTypeLabel.title: Domain Type Label

dt:domainTypeURI.description: identifier for the kind of values in the domain
dt:domainTypeURI.title: Identifier for Domain Type

oneOf.title: Link to Concept in this repository

dt:constraintStatements.description: one or more text statements that constrain values in the domain
dt:constraintStatements.title: Constraints on Domain Values

dt:valueFormat.description: template for the structure of the presentation of the value(s). EXAMPLE ? YYYY-MM-DD for a date., limitations on character string length. Typically some sort of regular expressions specifying syntax for the alphanumeric string that specifies data values. If the data type allows lists, format text should specify list boundary and delimiter characters.
dt:valueFormat.title: Value format template

dt:codeList.description: attribute value is restricted to terms from a vocabulary (pick list); this element identifies the approperiate vocabulary. Should this be an array to allow multiple possible codelists (controlled vocabularies)

dt:targetEntity.description: The attribute value is a link to another entity (foreign key). The URI identifies the target entity instance, which must conform to the conceptualValueType; the domainType must be 'reference' if this element has a value. For example if related tables in a database are being described, this value would specify the table that the reference values link (join) to.

dt:targetEntityURI.description: unique identifier that can be dereferenced to locate the target entity; only required for descriptions that apply to specific physical instances of a dataset
